title: South Korean KOSPI Hits Record High as Automakers Rally on AI Technology Optimism
description: South Korean shares achieved a record high on Monday, with the KOSPI index closing at 4,904.66 points, up 1.32% and extending gains to a 12th consecutive session. Automakers led the rally, with Hyundai Motor surging 16.22% to an all-time high and Kia gaining 12.18% on artificial intelligence optimism. Foreign investors were net buyers worth ₹552.30 billion won, while technology stocks like LG Electronics and HYBE also posted strong gains.
content: South Korean equities reached a historic milestone on Monday, with the benchmark KOSPI index surging to an unprecedented closing high, driven by strong investor optimism around artificial intelligence technologies and robust performance in the automo... [3462 chars]

title: Notes from Davos: Before the conversations begin
description: Delegates have arrived in Davos for the World Economic Forum. The town is alive with activity, with pavilions setting up and early conversations beginning. Artificial intelligence is a dominant theme this year, with a focus on practical applications and global coordination. Security is in place, and the stage is set for a week of intense dialogue and networking.

title: AI job apocalypse coming? Goldman Sachs warns AI could soon automate 25 percent of all work hours
description: Goldman Sachs analysts caution that artificial intelligence could automate a quarter of work hours, potentially displacing millions of jobs.

title: AI-driven pirated manga is booming. Can AI also help curb it?
description: While artificial intelligence is driving the spread of pirated manga online, Japanese government officials are hoping AI can also help rein it in.
content:
When it comes to pirated manga online, which is being produced quicker thanks to artificial intelligence, government officials in Japan are planning to fight fire with fire and use AI to crack down on it.

title: Is AI killing creativity-and is news the first casualty?

title: AI writes 3 Million lines of code and builds a full web browser in just one week, internet asks does it work
description: Artificial intelligence is improving as we speak. Now, Cursor CEO Michael Trulli has revealed that he got AI to write 3 million lines of code in just a week to build a full web browser. But the internet seems to be a bit sceptical over its functionality.
